featured.text: Both V2V and V2I have the potential to reduce around 80 percent of vehicle crashes on the road.

Another new technology being tested is Vehicle-to-Infrastructure communication, or V2I. V2I would allow vehicles to communicate with road signs or traffic signals and provide information to the vehicle about safety issues.
Bam once blossomed as a trading post on the Silk Road.

other.text: They also struck them with sticks to roll them down the road.

What made it necessary to build a road through the Glacier National Park? (A) There were too many parks in Montana.
It is one of the most scenic roads in North America.
Even today, visitors to the park marvel at how such a road could have been built.
The construction of the Going-to-the-Sun Road was a huge task.

The construction of the road has changed the way visitors experience the Glacier National Park.
The adapted rides include the Off-Road Adventure, where guests can test their driving skills in sporty vehicles.
In the 16th and 17th centuries, treasures from the Far East were carried along the road into the capital cities of Europe.
How has the Going-to-the-Sun Road influenced the way people experience the Glacier National Park? (A) The scenery along the road is too beautiful for visitors to drive carefully.

Eventually, the demand for a road across the mountains led to the building of the Going-to-the-Sun Road.
The road has allowed people to see more of the park in a shorter period of time.
After 11 years of work, the final section of the road was completed in 1932.

definition.en_def: A wide way leading from one place to another, typically paved for vehicles.
